result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell D Ferge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Participate and complete Drug Court Treatment Program.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Status conference on August 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Email from Br 10; a hearing scheduled on 7-24-14 to determine whether a plea will be entered in their branch for drug court; Br 7's final pretrial on the same day will be taken off the court's calendar and reset if needed
Status conference on July 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on July 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Def appeared for drug screening.  Full COMPAS evaluation scheduled for 7-10-14 @ 9:30.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 2:26
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Robert J Jambois.  Corey C Stephan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on June 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant referred for screening.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 7

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Chelsea Wetzjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
